definition: an open usually circular vessel with sloping or curving sides used typically for holding water for washing
a bowl used especially in cooking
the quantity contained in a basin
examples: spilled a basin of water on the floor

definition: a dock built in a harbor or a river that is noticeably affected by the tide
an enclosed or partly enclosed water area
a large or small depression in the surface of the land or in the ocean floor
examples: the relatively shallow basin of the Baltic Sea

definition: the entire tract of country drained by a river and its tributaries
examples: flooding in the Amazon river basin

definition: a great depression in the surface of the lithosphere occupied by an ocean
a broad area of the earth beneath which the strata (see stratum sense 2a) dip usually from the sides toward the center
